alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 26 at 12:07PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall runoff is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of western Maine, including the following counties, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. This includes the Ellis River through south Andover. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1206 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rumford, Andover, Weld, Mexico, Grafton, Carthage, Byron, Roxbury and Newry.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
